abstract: Although the billionaire declined to discuss specifics about President Obama’s banking plan, he did offer one tough general opinion: make sure the bosses of failing banks — and their spouses — pay very, very dearly.
snippet: Although the billionaire declined to discuss specifics about President Obama’s banking plan, he did offer one tough general opinion: make sure the bosses of failing banks — and their spouses — pay very, very dearly.
lead_paragraph: Given President Obama‘s new banking proposal, Liz Claman of Fox Business Network thought Thursday was “a perfect day” to talk to Warren E. Buffett — even though he had already given lengthy interviews the day before to Fox’s rivals, CNBC and Bloomberg Television. But the billionaire financier started out by disappointing Ms. Claman, saying he needed to examine the proposal, and he brushed aside pleas to comment on specifics.

headline.main: Buffett Really Wants to Punish Failed Bankers

abstract: Triple-digit stock drops this week could spook potential investors in the six companies hoping to launch their I.P.O.s on Friday.
snippet: Triple-digit stock drops this week could spook potential investors in the six companies hoping to launch their I.P.O.s on Friday.
lead_paragraph: This year’s market for initial public offerings will open Friday with six companies hoping to raise cash, the busiest debut day in more than two years. But triple-digit stock drops this week could spook potential investors and even lead to a postponed coming out party for some, The Associated Press said.

headline.main: Drops in Dow May Hurt 6 I.P.O.s Set for Friday

abstract: The 2010 market for initial public offerings kicked off to a tepid start, as Symetra Financial, a life insurer, priced at the low end of its range, while other companies testing investor appetite also found it weaker than expected.
snippet: The 2010 market for initial public offerings kicked off to a tepid start, as Symetra Financial, a life insurer, priced at the low end of its range, while other companies testing investor appetite also found it weaker than expected.
lead_paragraph: The 2010 market for initial public offerings kicked off to a tepid start, as Symetra Financial, a life insurer that counts Warren E. Buffett among its biggest shareholders, priced at the low end of its range, while other companies testing investor appetite also found it weaker than expected, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: I.P.O.’s Met With Tepid Response from Investors

abstract: Burlington Northern Santa Fe posted a drop in earnings, but the fact that they exceeded expectations may soothe investors in Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, which purchased Burlington late last year for $26.4 billion.
snippet: Burlington Northern Santa Fe posted a drop in earnings, but the fact that they exceeded expectations may soothe investors in Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, which purchased Burlington late last year for $26.4 billion.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes the train is faster than you think.
